intro: Turibana, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the genus Calotropis, which is part of the family Apocynaceae. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with purple markings and its milky sap. Turibana typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
